lines.text: Heat flows from warmer to cooler
Heat must flow in this direction to increase entropy

secText: Entropy helps to explain the direction of heat flow.
As heat flows from the left reservoir to the one on the right, the temperature and energy of the gas in that reservoir increases.
The speed and randomness − the entropy − of the gas there increases.
The second law of thermodynamics states that entropy must increase, which means heat must flow from warmer to cooler.
